channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Missing drain cover on A40, 15th August
item.description:
There is a drain cover / grill missing, heading towards Cheltenham roughly half way down the hill. Could be fatal for a cyclist hitting it at speed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A40, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown bush and brambles, 15th August
item.description:
Over grow hedge row and brambles forcing pedestrians on to grass verge (now worn to dirt). Brambles are about 8ft long
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Somerset Avenue, Cheltenham

item.title: Another broken kerb, 14th August
item.description:
Broken kerb on holtham avenue. 3/4 of the way down the street. To be honest the whole road needs addressing. This is the same problem on every kerb. The kerbs are to high and not laid in the road, they are laid on top of the road which leads to the kerbs falling down and this becomes dangerous for pedestrians and causes damage to cars in the local area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 33 Holtham Avenue, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big pothole by entrance to Homelands Farm., 13th August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Homelands Farm Cottage Gotherington Lane, Bishops Cleeve

item.title: Large bough snapped off highways tree, 13th August
item.description:
Glencairn Park Road, adjacent to entrance into Glencairn Court. Large bough has been snapped off tree on pavement - see attached photos showing tree one side of Glencairn Court entrance and bough now lying on pavement opposite side of entrance. Also photo attached of damage to tree. Debris needs to be removed, and tree needs to be inspected and tidied up. Tree is on pavement, so presumably is the responsibility of Highways?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Glencairn Park Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flood debris (Reported this 6 months ago!!), 12th August
item.description:
Please see attached picture of flood debris outside my property. (I reported this 6 months ago, 3 times). Since Gigga Clear dug up the footpath and layed it a few inches higher flood water now collects outside the front of my property brining all the debris from the road with it. Can you please come and clean it up. The drain is now also very full (it was not designed to cope with the new amount of water) Once the debris has been cleared I would like to talk to someone regarding the new flooding. My garden now get flooded also. It is causing real issues even during light rainfall.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 5 Church Row, Gretton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights not sensing cyclists., 12th August
item.description:
When approaching the traffic lights from the North on two bicycles, turning right onto the B4213 the traffic lights failed to change for us. Even when a fairly large truck pulled up behind us in the right filter lane they still didn't change. There is no pedestrian crossing at these lights so if they do not sense cyclists there is no safe way for a cyclist to use this junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Highfield Farm Lodge A38, Deerhurst
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 18 inch by 10 inch pot hole, 11th August
item.description:
18 inch by 10 inch pot hole in the middle of the road - The nearest house is number 1. This is not a particulary deep hole as such but its enough to warrant a repair. There are several smaller pot holes in close proximity to this one so could they be investigated and filled too please ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Bibury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
